title: List of Atari arcade games
data: The player as Officer Bob drives around the city from an overhead view , catches criminals and issues fines
A futuristic racing game where players race on twisting tubes
An unreleased prototype space shooter in which the player must defend a spaceship from approaching enemies and prevent them from building a cannon
Each player controls an anti-aircraft gun and tries to shoot down more aircraft than their opponent
Player can select from enhanced versions of earlier Atari games , Super Centipede or Missile Command II , both of which allow for two-player simultaneous play
The players attempt to kill the aliens and their mothership
Players can choose to play either of the previous games , Area 51 or Maximum Force
An updated version of Atari 's 1995 game with better graphics and smoother animation
The player must avoid floating asteroids and blast them to smithereens . Alien spacecraft must also be avoided or killed . One of Atari 's biggest hits
Sequel to Asteroids featuring harder gameplay , shields and automatic firing
A black and white video game of baseball where player compete against one another
A black and white basketball game where players can compete head-to-head
A black and white American football game where players are represented by X 's and O 's
An unreleased black and white mini-golf game
A black and white video game of soccer with players with X 's and O 's atop their heads
Players attempt to catch falling rocks via several paddles . Black and white , but uses a color overlay
intro: Atari was an early pioneer in the video game industry, in fact, they virtually created the industry with their introduction of the arcade game Pong. The brand name Atari was used for many years and applied to several other entities that developed products ranging from arcade video games to home video game consoles to home computers to video games for personal computers. Below is a list of arcade video games produced by Atari. These games were produced by Atari, Inc. from 1972 to 1984 starting with Pong and Atari Games from 1984 to 2000. Atari no longer manufacturers arcade games and, in fact, the entity that now owns the brand name (French company, Infogrames) never has. For a full list of games developed or published by Atari from 1972 to 1984, see List of Atari, Inc. games.
